subtitle: Check for loose bowel movements, fever and weight loss
description: Check for loose bowel movements, fever and weight loss
title: Does she have diarrhea?
content:
Created by BabyCenter



Your baby may have diarrhea if:

•	She has smelly, watery, bowel movements streaked with sticky smelly fluid, called mucus.

•	She has these bowel movements frequently.

•	She has a fever.

•	She appears to be losing weight.

Your baby can get diarrhea if she eats rotten food or drinks dirty water. 

Newborns often have a lot of bowel movements, sometimes up to 5 times a day in the first month, but this is unlikely to be diarrhea.

Sometimes babies have bowel movements after every breastfeeding session. This is because, as her stomach fills up with milk, her bowels get stimulated.

Breastfed babies usually have yellowish bowel movements which smell sweet, and they tend to be soft. After they reach 1 month old, most babies have 1 or 2 bowel movements a day.

Your baby’s bowel movements may change at 6 months when she starts solid food. But bowel movements will settle down once your baby gets used to her new food. 

So, notice your baby's bowel movements. If your baby has smelly, watery and mucus-streaked bowel movements more often, has a fever or seems to be losing weight, then your baby probably has diarrhea. Take her to a healthcare provider.

[Diarrhea in babies][1]



  [1]: http://www.babycenter.com/0_diarrhea-in-babies_82.bc
